titleStmt.title: James L. Marshall to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4442

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867
msIdentifier.idno: Box 9, 2 unnumbered leaves in seperate folder

body.p: To his Excellency The Govr of the Comth of Ky

Your Petitioner James L Marshall of Nelson County Would respectfully State That in 18521 or ^2^ he procured a Tavern License to Keep a Tavern in the Town of Fairfield in this County Which he supposed give him the right to Retail ardent Spirits But to his astonishment he was Indicted and at the June Term of the Nelson Circuit Court 1852 The Case was Submitted and a fine of Forty five dollars entered and Mr Phil Thompson who was prosecuting atty at the time released his portion of the fine and directed the proceedings Stays until he could hear from the Gov But he no doubt failed to Write to the Gov and this Judgement remains unpaid except the Costs and atty. fee and your Petitioner being in a low stage of health Poor and a large family with but little hope of many days to live Would ask your Excellency to remit the fine as he has but little propety The Only Horse which he owned having been Seized and taken off Some months ago by that notorious Band of Robbers called Morgans men and health so feeble that he is entirely unable to Work hoping that you will grant the request your Petitioner Will only add that he hopes you may be guided through those troublesome times by Our great Gov of Heaven
Subscribed and Sworn to by J. L. Marshall before me this 30th December 1863 J. E. Gardner J. P. N. C

We the undersigned citizens of Nelson County would respectfully State. That we are well acquainted with James L Marshall, The Petioner, and believe the Statements made by him to be true. he being a moral Honest law abiding citizens, and pray the Governor that his request be granted. Believing as we do, that if ever a case has occurred in Kentucky calling for the interposition of the Executor this case is one, and hope it will be granted

S. McKenna
Danl Prust
B. B. Wootton
George Watson
John Mason
E. C. Tichenor
J. N. Elder
A. L. Tichenor
Reiney Wootton
A. Bryant
H. G. Marshall
W. J. Wellington
Y P Bryant
James Simpson
J J Tichenor
J. E. Gardiner
W. W. Grigsby
P W Wells
W. Pitt
R. C. Hagan
C Ludwick
Wm Gardine
J. R. Bodin
Jas Shankey
John D. Lilly
John W. Simpson

Nelson Cir Ct
vs
Jas L. Marshall
June term 1852
$45.
Tipling

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
Gov
